result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Criminal Bond.
It is hereby ordered that Mr. Green's bond in the above referenced case be amended from a requirement that he "have no contact with Lori Knipp, Heather Carty, and the residence at 1669 Atlantic Circle, Manitowoc, WI" to a requirement that he "have no contact with Lori Knipp and the residence at 1669 Atlantic Circle, Manitowoc, WI and have no assaultive contact with Heather Carty".  All other conditions of bond in the above referenced case are ordered to remain in effect.

records.addlTxt:
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-13-16 at 9:00 a.m.   
Minutes.
Request for Substitution of Judge
RE:  Heather Carty, on 03-17-16.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of criminal trespass to dwelling and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-28-16 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $25.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Lori Knipp, Heather Carty and the residence at 1669 Atlanta Circle, Manitowoc, WI.  A one time contact, with police escort, to collect personal belongings, is allowed after 72 hours.  Bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
